etymology.description: pictogram: an arrow; more recognizable in older forms.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a straight shaft with a pointed head, representing an arrow in early scripts. Usage later extended to mean “to vow/pledge,” as in set phrases like 矢志, evoking firmness and unwavering intent.

examples.chinese: 他拉弓射矢(他拉弓射矢)。
examples.english: He draws the bow and shoots an arrow.

examples.chinese: 我们矢志不渝(我們矢志不渝)。
examples.english: We are steadfast in our resolve.

examples.chinese: 古人以矢为信(古人以矢為信)。
examples.english: In ancient times, people used an arrow as a token of trust.
